items.title: Porto en Farioli nemen na rust afstand van hekkensluiter en verruimen voorsprong
items.summary: FC Porto heeft 2025 met drie punten afgesloten. In eigen huis duurde het nog redelijk lang voordat de koploper afrekende met hekkensluiter AVS. Twee goals van Samu maakten het verschil.

items.title: Riedewald met een schaars maar belangrijk doelpunt
items.summary: Ook maandag wordt er weer gevoetbald in de Afrika Cup. Het Egypte van Mohamed Salah staat tegenover Angola en Marokko treft Zambia. Volg het belangrijkste voetbal van maandag in deze VI Live.

items.title: Jordan James completes double over Derby to lift sour mood at Leicester
items.summary: Doing a December double over Derby may have offered Leicester fans some festive cheer but it is unlikely to brook the longstanding resentment against a board whose treatment of staff over Christmas has only exacerbated ill will at the King Power Stadium. First-half goals from Bobby De Cordova-Reid and Jordan James sandwiched Rhian Brewster‚Äôs equaliser to earn manager Mart√≠ Cifuentes some respite after successive defeats. Leicester are four points off the playoff zone ahead of Thursday‚Äôs visit to in-form Sheffield United. Continue reading...

items.title: Hakimi returns as Morocco seal AFCON knockouts
items.summary: Africa Cup of Nations hosts Morocco dispatched Zambia 3-0 at a fervid Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat on Monday to round off their Group A campaign in style and ease into the round of 16.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal 'actively looking' for January deals
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has said the club are prepared to ease their injury problems by "actively looking" at signing new players when the transfer window reopens next month.

items.title: Ronaldo wants 1k goals; open to Europe return
items.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has reiterated his desire to reach 1,000 career goals before he calls time on his playing career.

items.title: Wrexham into top half of Championship after win
Afcon roundup: Morocco outclass Zambia to storm into last 16 while Mali squeeze through
items.summary: Morocco 3-0 Zambia | Mali 0-0 Comoros South Africa and Egypt through, Angola face nervous wait Morocco forward Ayoub El Kaabi netted a double and the midfield maestro Brahim D√≠az added another as the Africa Cup of Nations hosts turned in a convincing performance in outclassing Zambia 3-0 on Monday to top Group A. El Kaabi powered home an early headed goal and then scored with one of his trademark bicycle kicks while D√≠az netted for the third successive game as Morocco swept their opponents aside to finish on seven points ahead of second-placed Mali on three. Continue reading...

items.title: Aston Villa defy gravity again as winning run rolls on at Chelsea
items.summary: Villa keep coming from behind, keep winning by the odd goal and keep confounding the numbers. At some point it must stop ‚Äì but not yet It can‚Äôt go on. It makes no sense that it goes on. And yet it goes on. Aston Villa went into Saturday‚Äôs Premier Leage game at Chelsea having won 10 games in a row, looking to match a record set in 1897 and 1914. For an hour there seemed no chance they would achieve it, as Chelsea outplayed them, took the lead and could have had several more. But Chelsea are vulnerable with a lead, especially at home, and Villa have developed a baffling habit of winning away games having gone behind. This is an extract from Soccer with Jonathan Wilson, a weekly look from the Guardian US at the game in Europe and beyond. Subscribe for free here. Have a question for Jonathan? Email soccerwithjw@theguardian.com, and he‚Äôll answer the best in a future edition. Continue reading...

items.title: AS Roma bezorgt clublegende De Rossi terugkeer met twee gezichten
items.summary: Daniele De Rossi kan in sportief opzicht niet terugkijken op een fijne terugkeer bij zijn oude werkgever AS Roma. De Romeinen hadden aan √©√©n helft genoeg om Genoa van al hun aspiraties te beroven: 3-1.

items.title: Bournemouth eye Johnson - Tuesday's gossip
items.summary: Bournemouth identify Brennan Johnson and Abdul Fatawu as potential replacements for Antoine Semenyo, Liverpool want to wait until the summer to sign Marc Guehi, and Everton are interested in Manchester United duo Kobbie Mainoo and Joshua Zirkzee, plus more.

items.title: Deze landen kan Marokko in de achtste- en kwartfinale treffen op de Afrika Cup
items.summary: Marokko verzekerde zich maandagavond als winnaar van Groep A voor de knockout-fase van de Afrika Cup. De Leeuwen van de Atlas hebben zich dus bij de laatste zestien van het toernooi gevoegd en dat biedt kans om alvast vooruit te kijken tegen wie er mogelijk gespeeld gaat worden.

items.title: Marokko swingt mede door n√≥g een fenomenale omhaal naar de achtste finales
items.summary: Marokko is in het nieuwe jaar nog te zien op de Afrika Cup. Het gastland van het toernooi was in de allesbeslissende wedstrijd veel te sterk voor Zambia. Hoogtepunt was een tweede rake omhaal van Ayoub El Kaabi.

items.title: Ipswich stun leaders Coventry to breathe life into Championship promotion race
items.summary: Ipswich narrowed the gap on the Championship‚Äôs top two with an impressive 2-0 win at Coventry, ending the leaders‚Äô unbeaten home record this season. Jack Clarke opened the scoring after 72 minutes and Wes Burns‚Äô first goal since April 2024 doubled the visitors‚Äô lead 11 minutes later. The Tractor Boys had started the day 13 points behind Frank Lampard‚Äôs team and five behind second-placed Middlesbrough after a run of four away matches without a win. Continue reading...

items.title: Forest ask for VAR audio after Man City defeat
items.summary: Nottingham Forest have asked to hear the VAR audio as they consider making an official complaint following the Premier League defeat by Manchester City.

items.title: Goals of the year 2025: dazzling skills, acrobatics and sublime strikes
items.summary: From jaw-dropping tricks to scorpion kicks, flicks, solo efforts and more ‚Äì enjoy our pick of 2025‚Äôs best goals The very definition of top bins: James Edmondson pops one right in the stanchion at Slough Town to help Macclesfield Town into the third round of the FA Cup. items.title: Ipswich win at Coventry to close gap on Boro; Leicester, Wrexham win - EFL highlights
Sutton's predictions v singer-songwriter & Sunderland fan Tom A Smith
items.summary: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter and Sunderland fan Tom A Smith - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

items.title: Manby continues dream run at Ally Pally while Aspinall suffers exit
items.summary: Charlie Manby reached the last 16 of the World Darts Championship on debut after defeating 'Rapid' Ricky Evans 4-2 as crowd-favourite Nathan Aspinall was knocked out.

items.title: Van de Ven lifts lid on Spurs' hectic 2025
items.summary: It has been a topsy-turvy year at Tottenham Hotspur, with Micky van de Ven lifting the lid on a memorable but ever-changing year at Spurs.
